skill.name: research-synthesizer
skill.description: Synthesizes provided sources neutrally; separates quotes from paraphrase and avoids ungrounded claims.
skill.summary: Synthesizes provided sources neutrally; separates quotes from paraphrase and avoids ungrounded claim...
skill.author: ACSKamloops

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only SKILL.md with instruction guidelines. No executable code, no network access, no filesystem access beyond its own file, no environment variable access, and no external commands. This is a simple prompt template skill.

content.user_title: Synthesize research sources with neutral tone
content.value_statement: When you need to summarize research materials, you often blend quotes with paraphrases or make unsupported claims. This skill ensures neutral synthesis with clear source attribution and explicit uncertainty flags about what is and is not supported by the provided text.
actual_capabilities: Neutral synthesis of research sources in plain language
Clear separation of direct quotes from paraphrased content
Explicit identification of claims not supported by provided sources
Concise bullet summaries with clear next steps for deeper review
limitations: Does not provide real-time internet access or search external sources
Cannot verify accuracy of claims outside the provided source material
Works only with user-provided materials; does not fetch or discover sources independently
Does not generate citations in specific formatting styles like APA or MLA

use_cases.title: Literature review preparation
use_cases.description: Synthesize multiple academic papers into clear summaries for literature reviews

use_cases.title: Source consolidation
use_cases.description: Neutral synthesis of policy documents and research findings for briefs

use_cases.title: Research note organization
use_cases.description: Organize and summarize research sources for essays and academic assignments

prompt_templates.title: Basic Synthesis
prompt_templates.prompt: Synthesize this source using neutral, plain language. Separate direct quotes from paraphrases. Note explicitly which claims are and are not supported by the text.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Source Comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare and synthesize these sources on [TOPIC]. Highlight agreements, disagreements, and areas of uncertainty. Use clear attribution for each point.

prompt_templates.title: Key Findings Extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract the main findings from this research material. Use concise bullet points. Identify any gaps in the research and what conclusions are not supported.

prompt_templates.title: Critical Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate this study or document. Note methodology limitations and clearly state which conclusions are and are not supported by the evidence provided.

output_examples.input: Synthesize this article on climate change impacts on agriculture.
output: Key finding: Crop yields could decrease by 20% by 2050 under high-emission scenarios based on model projections.
Direct quote: 'The relationship between temperature and yield is non-linear', p. 45.
Supported claim: Higher temperatures increase pest pressure on major crops.
Unsupported claim: The study does not address regional adaptation strategies or economic impacts.
Next steps: Review regional studies for local projections and consult economic impact analyses.

best_practices: Provide the full text or substantial excerpts rather than just URLs or titles
Specify the synthesis format you need such as bullet points, paragraphs, or tables
Mention any specific topics, questions, or aspects to focus on in the synthesis
anti_patterns: Asking the skill to invent citations, references, or claims not present in the source material
Requesting synthesis without providing any source material or content
Expecting the skill to verify factual claims outside the provided sources or perform external research

faq.question: Does this skill search the internet for sources?
faq.answer: No. You must provide the sources you want synthesized. The skill works only with your provided materials.

faq.question: Can it generate APA or MLA citations?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on synthesizing content and identifying where citations are needed. It does not format citations in specific styles.

faq.question: How many sources can it handle at once?
faq.answer: The skill can handle multiple sources, but very large numbers may reduce quality. Consider batching large collections into groups.

faq.question: Is my data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill that runs entirely within your AI tool. Source material is not transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why are some claims marked as unsupported?
faq.answer: The skill only synthesizes what is in your provided sources. Claims, conclusions, or assertions not found in sources are explicitly flagged as unsupported.

faq.question: How is this different from regular summarization?
faq.answer: Research synthesis maintains source fidelity. It clearly separates direct quotes from paraphrased content and explicitly flags uncertainty or unsupported claims.
